Please reach out to us at 1-800-888-4848 or via email at appfeedback@subway.com.', 'modified': '2017-11-06T15:35:39Z'}

title: This App Has Gone Downhill
review:
Subway is the closest place to my office, so I go there all the time. The app usually is very convenient, but lately I‚Äôve had an experience that is just frustrating and it‚Äôs been going on for about a month now. For starters, I am unable to apply the $2 off any of my orders. Errors have been occurring every time I‚Äôve tried to use it.

The errors have come up EVERY TIME I use the app now. It takes 2 or 3 tries for me to get a confirmation of an order. 
However I just found out a few days ago that even though the error occurs, the order still gets sent to the restaurant without me knowing, and I get double or triple charged for my orders, and I still only get the one confirmation. Y‚Äôall need to really try to work on the commutation between the guest and the restaurant and the app, because it‚Äôs ridiculous to get errors every time I try to put a order in and then get charged for a sandwich order I didn‚Äôt even know went through.

title: Update Stores on App
review: I have used the Subway app 2 times and both have been HORRIBLE! First use I made an order from the app and went to pick my order up and the location advised, they were closed and no longer making orders. Which I had to wait 2 days and go back there to be refunded. The second time has turned me off completely! I placed an order, only to arrive to the location and it was closed! Also, was told by the station it was attached too that it has been closed for 2 days with no word on reopening. I tried calling the 800 number and was told everything is now by email, so I sent in a message advising of the situation and that now I was out of money for subs that I could not get and would like a refund. I received a message back advising ‚Äú Thank you for your feedback, our apologies on not updating our app, I have forwarded your reply to our management team. However, no info on my refund or anything!  I would have given no stars if I could. I will never use this app to order food again!!

title: Great app, but could use work!
review: I love the Subway app and use it often. I visit many locations and have found the app to be very useful. I mostly visit two different Subways near me, but especially the one closest to home. The Subway location on the app close to my home does not reflect certain information correctly. They offer breakfast all day, which is something I order often, but the app says they do not. Therefore, I‚Äôm unable to order breakfast at any point of the day on the app. They also have pepper relish at this location, but it‚Äôs not a selection on the app. I have reached out to Corporate about updating the selection criteria for this particular location a while back, and haven‚Äôt seen any changes. I hope one day they make these changes so I can properly use the app for my favorite Subway location.

Thanks!\r\n', 'modified': '2019-08-20T19:54:58Z'}

title: Not letting me sign in
review: When i tried to make an account and half of the keyboard was cut off and it was also at the top of my screen. Went to safari to make an account because i thought ‚Äúsmall bug for creating accounts‚Äù but no it‚Äôs the same for signing in. I‚Äôm deleting the app and seeing if anything changes in a month. I also really only got the app so i can count my calories because the website on safari wouldn't let me build a sandwich due to it being midnight and they‚Äôre closed. But i thought to myself that the app will probably let you order ahead and it doesn't. It also doesn't let you order as a guest. 1/5 stars because you tried and i‚Äôm sure its hard to keep up an app but you're a big company you should do better for customers and your employees. I say employees as well because i read a review that its been hard for stores to get orders from online/from the app. Maybe take those options away for a while and figure out how to make it better for your employees? Apps are very convenient but not when they aren't working.

title: No way to cancel order or stop order immediately!  Bad experience
review: I will neverrrrrr order from a mobile app again . I trusted subways app because I had been using it for the longest, and I can link my PayPal account to it.... however, SUBWAY in Fayette, MS on the other hand, has workers there who are not concerned about helping customers. I made a mistake and ordered two of the same wraps on the mobile app. I called in to the store to cancel one and the girls giggled and said No they couldn‚Äôt do anything. I then called customer service, they said they couldn‚Äôt do anything either all they could do is reach out to the franchise owner. How do you not have an OPTION TO CANCEL an order you just submitted not even minutes ago!!! No one wants to cancel my order and refund me my money.  I never want to go into this store again. Hours later the girls call my phone laughing and saying these exact words ‚Äúyou need to come pick up your order‚Äù I said ‚ÄúI told you hours ago I did not want the order‚Äù she says ‚Äúso, you already paid for it come and get it‚Äù and hung the phone up in my face!
developerResponse: {'id': 3826417, 'body': 'We apologize for any inconvenience this caused. Please contact us at (833)-778-2929 or appfeedback@subway.com. so that we can make this right! Please mention your concerns, the restaurant location, and your user name while contacting us. We look forward to hearing from you.', 'modified': '2018-06-13T14:15:14Z'}

title: Terrible App
review: During the pandemic I get several ads for this ‚ÄúFamily Takeout Deal‚Äù for the buy one, get one free footlong and you‚Äôd think every store would offer this right now. Actually finding a Subway that offers this is so impossible that it‚Äôs ridiculous and I live in a major city. I even called the location closest to me and asked if they did the family take out deal and the employee just says ‚Äúuhhh what is that..?‚Äù  REALLY? Their employees don‚Äôt even know what‚Äôs being advertised. They just pick and choose which locations will actually give you a discount and you have to take the time just to track it down if it even does exist. Because the ‚Äúdeals‚Äù section in the app is completely blank, I have to go through to choose a location, pick 2 subs, and wait until the end to see the cart only to find out that that location doesn‚Äôt do the discount.... I use to work for Subway before this app and things were a lot easier then. You‚Äôre driving business away when you advertise a BOGO and then your company‚Äôs employees know nothing about it

title: Update is awful
review: The app used to be intuitive. Now it‚Äôs cumbersome and won‚Äôt let you choose options. Favorites are no longer easy to use either. So I have to rely on going to my history. Problem is they don‚Äôt give you any information on the summary screen about the details of the orders are so you constantly have to close and open each one to see if that‚Äôs the one that you would like to re-order. It also will not let you use your rewards and less you start from scratch on the order. So it takes away the convenience. And when I tried to place my order from scratch for a breakfast sandwich it will not let me choose a white eggs or mozzarella cheese I am stuck with the standard items and then I have to make all kinds of notes in the comments so they will even know what to make. It went from a nice app to a nightmare. I also find that text I get on deals I cannot use through the app so I have no way of applying the deal to my order.  I am treated better as a customer that signed up for text than a repeat customer.
developerResponse: {'id': 6241833, 'body': "Your feedback is really important to us and we're always looking for ways to improve your experience! Feel free to reach out to us at (833)-778-2929 or via email at appfeedback@subway.com.", 'modified': '2018-12-04T18:42:10Z'}

title: Do NOT order delivery using the app
review: The subway I typically go to is good and has good staff, however it doesn‚Äôt seem like subway pays attention to who the delivery drivers they hire are. When my order arrived, half of one of the footlongs was missing and the remaining 6 inch had been crudely rewrapped. I‚Äôve never had an issue with the store and it genuinely appears that the delivery driver just chose to take half of a foot long and attempted to badly rewrap the rest. When I called the store, they said there was nothing they could do other than remake the order and have me go to the store to pick it up since they can‚Äôt put in complains about the delivery drivers either or do anything else about it. If delivery is going to continue to be an option through the app, there also needs to be a way to rate and place complaints about the delivery drivers. I will no longer be using the app for deliveries and will instead use Ubereats or any other delivery service when I find myself wanting to order subway again.

title: Works great!  But....
review:
I love the app. unlike other reviewers, the swiping left on items to customize or remove is a breeze.  My only criticism is the dressings selection.  If you order a salad. there is no where to add a salad dressing, such as fat free Italian. I am only left with the comments area to ask for a Italian dressing.  And most of the time the people at the subway location don't even read them.  I always get asked at the window or register, ‚ÄúDid you want any dressing?  I tell them,‚ÄùI wrote it in the comment area!‚Äù Their response,‚Äù Oh we never see or read that area.‚Äù.   OH BOY... sad.

I think all dressings should be listed for selection. Yea you get the normal selections mayo, mustard, red wine vinegar..etc... but not any of the other choices. I hope the developer reads this comment / review.  And seriously takes this request enhancement under consideration. 

Otherwise great app.  No waiting, just stop pickup and go!

title: Ready time is rarely correct
review:
I‚Äôve used this app for several dozen orders in the last couple of years. Overall it works, but I‚Äôve had numerous problems including:

1) orders are rarely ready by the time estimated. Usually it‚Äôs another 5 to 10 minutes or more. Staff do not appear concerned about this. Of course they can be busy, but what good is a time statement if it‚Äôs consistently missed?

2) app does not refund missing items. I added avocado today, but the store was out. The store and app have no way to remove that charge. They offered to give me cookies or a bottle of water, but I didn‚Äôt want any of those. 

3) ingredients are often omitted. We ordered a tuna sandwich a few months back. Picked it up, drove to a picnic spot, and discovered the sandwich had no tuna. Today a BMT was missing the pepperoni. No indication the staff realized the omission. There‚Äôs no way to report problems or request a refund. 

4) favorites are often useless. If you try to order a favorite, but that store doesn‚Äôt have a particular ingredient in the favorite, it won‚Äôt let you add it. It won‚Äôt tell you what is unavailable. Only choices are ‚ÄúFind another location‚Äù and ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù‚Äîwhich skips adding the sandwich and returns you to the main menu. It should show you what is unavailable, and then let you add the sandwich anyway and customize as normal.

title: Stole my money
review: Normally this app works great. However yesterday I tried to use it. I ordered my food and pressed place order. It got stuck there. The money was pending out of my account but I never got an order confirmation and when I went to the store that was supposed to have my order they said they never got the order and there was nothing they could do. So I went and took out the cash from my account because they guaranteed me that the money would not actually go through. So I paid in cash and this morning my account is now negative with a $25 over draft fee and soon to be more overdraft fees because I have other things coming out of my account. There is no number or email or anything to contact someone to get my money back even though the people at the subway store I ordered from said there was. All they can say is they have nothing to do with the app and I can contact someone on the app. But I can‚Äôt and now this little mistake is gonna cost me $100 in overdraft fees. That‚Äôs RIDICULOUS. Thank for stealing my money and costing me more!

title: Not my favorite way to order anymore
review: An order was placed at the wrong location (I thought it used the location a) I have selected at "my location" and b) the closest to me and NOPE it chose a location 20 miles away. I tried to cancel and all it did was tell me to call the store. She told me she canceled and for whatever reason, I was still charged. So now I've paid for two Subway lunches on the same day/time but only got it once. Now I have to go fight for my money back instead of this app having a more secured way of canceling the payment and not having to trust the store employees will do it correctly. UPDATE: I was able to send feedback through the overall Subway website and was corresponded with immediately and in just under a week (still a little longer than I think it should've taken) I did receive my money back. I had to go pick up cash though (he was able to refund my card for some reason).
developerResponse: {'id': 1246165, 'body': 'We apologize for the inconvenience. Please contact us at 1-800-888-4848 or appfeedback@subway.com. so that we can make this right. Please mention the restaurant location, date/time you placed the order, and your user name when contacting us.', 'modified': '2017-09-13T11:01:06Z'}

title: Absent Customer Support Even With Fraud
review:
Back in June of 2022, I purchased a Subway gift card because of their promotion to get a free 6‚Äù for doing so at the time. I used about $10 that day of the $25 gift card. About a month afterward, I got an email from Subway about a visit at a Texas location asking for my feedback (I live in Illinois). I immediately created a ticket with customer service through the Subway website (because to ‚Äúbetter serve‚Äù customers, you can no longer call them). I have still not heard back from them. I then decide to call the phone number listed on my credit card statement who was only able to redirect me back to Subway by ‚Äúraising‚Äù the issue. The gift card currently has less than $1 because of the fraud that occurred by someone using the digital gift card at a Texas location. 

Subway does not care about this. They have not made a single effort to make it right. I am appalled with their customer ‚Äúservice‚Äù and frankly this app because that‚Äôs where all of this began.

title: This isn‚Äôt a critical or financial app
review:
Look, I understand that you want customers on the latest version of your app, but this isn‚Äôt a banking or financial services app, and even many of those allow you to use the app, even when an update is available. 

Not that it isn‚Äôt already extremely frustrating to be forced to update when all you wanted to do was scan for points or scan to pay, but to make matters worse, every time you force an update you also log us out. 

most of us not are app experts, but all of us have enough apps to have an opinion regarding the difference between good app practices, critical app practices and annoying app practices. Subway continues to fall into the latter - you are not a banking app and if you have to force updates to patch critical errors (at every update) then perhaps you need new developers who don‚Äôt leave our data at risk every time a new version becomes available. And if that‚Äôs not what‚Äôs happening, then STOP WITH THE FORCED UPDATES & ACCOUNT LOGOUTS FOR A FRICKIN SANDWICH!

title: Simply horrible
review: I‚Äôve had nothing but problems from the local subways, usually long (we‚Äôre taking an hour plus) waits because they refuse to hire enough people.  I thought I could give the app a try.  So I put together an order for the sub meals, being given several errors along the way slowing me down. I press the checkout button after spending about 15 minutes putting the order together, and then it comes up with ‚Äú we‚Äôre sorry, this location can‚Äôt take your online order right more‚Äù. Frustrated already, let‚Äôs try the other subway in town. I put that order together only to find out they aren‚Äôt honoring the current deal and it would cost almost $20 more for my order. Of course complaining to the store does no good. Last time subway forwarded my complaint to the store owner, who simply said to send him anyone I knew who might be wanting a job(this was after an hour long wait for a phone order placed hours prior).  I give up, deleted the app. Forget subway and their horrible service, there are better options.

title: Racist, Rude, Unprofessional Manager at 4405 Elvis Presley in Memphis Tn
review:
I placed a Order Online. Picked up order & got home & realized the Manager made our Subs wrong. I called & she talked to me as if I was a dog. She was yelling & over talking me. Stated she was remaking sandwich nor refunding even tho my order was wrong. The Manager was extremely racist, rude, unprofessional, unsanitary & the most rude person I seen in my life. She told me to leave before she call the police & told us to get up out the chairs and stand up. The police came & tried to talk to her about refunding me since the food was incorrect & I no longer wanted the sandwiches. She said NO. She was touching surfaces & picking up things off the floor not washing her hands then she kept touching everybody food as if she was trying to get customers sick. The Manager was completely violating COVID19 regulations. The food was never ate & I‚Äôm stuck without a refund. I will NEVER IN MY LIFE visit subway again with RUDE RACIST UNPROFESSIONAL Managers like her. SHE NEEDS TO BE FIRED. The location on the Subway is 4405 Elvis Presley Blvd in Memphis, Tennessee.

This happened April 28, 2020 around 1:17pm

title: Five but not happy
review:
So I‚Äôve used this app many times actually. I love this app it was super easy to use but now since the developers tweaked it it won‚Äôt let me on anymore. When I pull up the main screen and enter my info it said forgot your password let‚Äôs get you a new one so I changed it but every time I put in my info, I hit accept new terms it just takes me back to the forgot your password screen. 

       The app is not realizing that I have accepted the new terms and letting me into the actual app, I am not a reviewer by any means but I feel if something‚Äôs added or been taken away it‚Äôs my job to let you know how things are running and it‚Äôs not smoothly. I gave this app five stars because in the beginning the app worked great but now I can‚Äôt even use it, it‚Äôs only using up storage on my phone.
developerResponse: {'id': 3642151, 'body': 'Developer Response (Pending) - May 29, 2018 It may take up to 24 hours for this response to appear on the App Store.\nWe appreciate your patience while we investigated the concerns you shared with us. Please uninstall and reinstall the Subway¬Æ App from your device, and the concern that you mentioned should be corrected. If you could follow up to let us know that this has been resolved, we would truly appreciate it. Thank You.', 'modified': '2018-05-29T17:55:33Z'}

title: Employees need app training
review:
The app is buggy - kept making me delete everything and start again if I wanted to change one thing. It kept changing the bread I wanted. Subway REALLY wants me to have 9 grain bread. It made me do 2 orders instead of allowing me to just order 2 sandwiches. We couldn‚Äôt cancel our order when the sandwiches weren‚Äôt made.

The big problem is that the employees of our Subway weren‚Äôt able to figure out what the app said. My husband ran in, they hadn‚Äôt even started, and were standing there totally baffled by our basic sandwich orders. He told them we didn‚Äôt have time to wait, and to cancel our order. It‚Äôs been nearly a week, and the charges are still on our account. We paid nearly $20, in advance, for sandwiches we never got. The bank is going to fight the charge. 

I love the idea of ordering ahead, and picking it up in a flash. That would be great, even if I do have to erase and redo the order a couple of times. But the employees have to understand how the app works, and there has to be a way to cancel a sale.

Please mention your concerns, the restaurant location, and your user name while contacting us. We look forward to hearing from you. \r\n', 'modified': '2019-08-27T14:26:25Z'}

title: I was so excited about this app until...
review:
Downloaded the app, created my profile, tried to add a payment method... no dice. So maybe it will let me after I create an order? Put two customized sandwiches in there, added a couple of cookies, tried to add a payment method... nope. Maybe it doesn‚Äôt like Discover? I‚Äôll try adding a MasterCard instead. Hmm... still nope. Well, maybe I have to place the order first? Nope. Can‚Äôt do that either. I have an iPhone 8+ and a reasonably new version of the iOS (11.3). You folks just updated the app about a week or so ago. This is disappointing. üôÅ

UPDATE: so I saw someone mention updating something on the website... and so I logged in there and - lo and behold! - it let me add my Discover card there. When I came back to the app, I fiddled around for a second and it let me order with my Discover card. But you folks aren‚Äôt off the hook! I should have been able to do all this on the app. So please fix that? Thanks!

Could you let us know the city and zip code you were trying to save your card info with, so we can investigate and address these concerns for you.? You may email us at appfeedback@subway.com. Thank You!", 'modified': '2018-08-23T13:44:55Z'}

title: Took the $, didn‚Äôt push the App order through!
review:
IDK if Subway and Taco Bell‚Äôs App developers are the same people, because I‚Äôve had the same issue with both Apps getting all the way to the Order Payment/Confirmation screens only to suddenly have a ‚ÄúTechnical Error‚Äù and tell me my payment either rejected or just take me back to the submit page as if the order didn‚Äôt go through (because it didn‚Äôt) yet my bank account shows the subtracted amount, leaving the poor workers at the physical restaurant wondering what‚Äôs happened because there‚Äôs no order for them, and they have no App experience or even know what to do, and they‚Äôre stuck dealing with an upset customer. 
This happened twice in the Taco Bell app before I deleted it, but it looks like imma have to delete the Subway app too now. I have the latest version of iOS, my app is up to date, my card is activated, on file, and has funding, and I made the order in 5g WiFi in my house, so I know it‚Äôs not anything on my end!

title: To creators
review: For the creators ‚Ä¶  so I actually do like app testing and give feedback as a like side gig and when I use a new app I can‚Äôt help but to offer my opinion ‚Ä¶ when I was placing my order I had multiple similar items 3 subs and many cookies ‚Ä¶ well everytime i would finish one sub sandwich I was asked if I was ready to check out or continue shopping ‚Ä¶ Then when I hit continue shopping it redirected me all the way back into the main menu to navigate my way back to the subs all over again ‚Ä¶ which was irritating and I feel unnecessary. If the customer is adding their last item you may be better off to add in some add on items ‚Ä¶ preferably your higher selling ones per the general district area ‚Ä¶ it asked me if I was ready to check out so many times I got irritated and just checked out instead of getting the other chips and cookies I had wanted ‚Ä¶

title: Beware
review: Worked great the first couple times then I had an issue where it defaulted to a previous pickup time hours later than I wanted it. The people in the store said there was a 1800 number on the app because it isn‚Äôt actually subway‚Äôs app it is ran by a 3rd party so after scouring the app I see it says call the store to cancel. Seeing as how I had already tried this I decided to just go to the store where they advise me to just not pick up my order later and the order and pay then and there and that worked. NOW a couple days ago I get an email saying thanks for updating your app your order will be ready soon. SOMEONE HACKED MY ACCOUNT changed my name to their name and paid for their order in Chicago with my credit card. I live in Indiana. I call the number the email provided for if I didn‚Äôt make that order only for it to tell me they went all digital and to send an email complaint. Bottom line the app is INSECURE AND TO GET HELP ON OR WITH! Just order in store save yourself the headache. Shame on you subway for launching such a spotty app!

title: Buyer beware..
review:
Been using this app for a few months now with no issues. But recently was visiting a family in Ohio and tried to use the app to make a purchase which has been a nightmare. The app has incorrect hours of operation! They charged me for 2 sandwiches and told me they would be ready at 9:30 pm. Show up to the subway store to be greeted by what looked like an employee who hated her job. She told me to come back tmrw for my subs! Fast food should be exactly that I have no interest in driving out to a location to claim subs I needed that evening. They have yet to give me a refund, how an app can simply charge you and have no way of processing a refund is mind blowing. Very disappointed in subway.

FYI did contact customer service and was told the store would need 48hrs to refund and not worry. That time has come and gone with no refund. I love how all the responses are subway cares and to call them to make it right. Don‚Äôt bother unless you want to wait for 30 minute to talk to someone who can‚Äôt do a thing. App is simply a way for stores to steal money.
developerResponse: {'id': 7734180, 'body': 'Hi, there- could you reach out to appfeedback@subway.com, with your contact info so my team may make this right for you? Please ask to have the email sent to Chris, and we will look into the concerns right away. We look forward to hearing from you.', 'modified': '2019-03-14T14:32:18Z'}

title: Works great to locate the closest location.  That‚Äôs about as far as it gets.
review: Gave it 2 stars because I used to use it all the time to grab a quick lunch while at work.  It was easy to order and even easier to pick up when it was done.  For the past couple months it‚Äôs been nothing more than a location finder.  It errors out when trying to order and when looking for the rewards you‚Äôve earned.  It is nothing more than a battery/space hog on my phone due to it being absolutely useless.  **Note to the developer, please do not respond to this review with one of your canned responses.    You‚Äôre better off not saying a word than opening up your mouth and confirming to everyone that you really don‚Äôt care.  Everyone of your responses are the exact same every time.  Subway has literally lost my weekly business due to your incompetence and crappy customer service skills.  Oh and by the way, your latest update (yesterday) fixed absolutely nothing.  Bravo.

We would love to investigate these issues regarding successful orders and MyWay Rewards functionality for you personally- but to do so, we need a bit more information and a way to contact you once we have resolved your concerns. We are here for you, at (833)-778-2929, or by email at appfeedback@subway.com. Have your app version, device type, and the steps to reproduce any errors ready- so we can investigate and address these concerns. Thank You!", 'modified': '2018-07-26T15:23:53Z'}

title: Great app!
review: I use this app constantly. If you like subway, then you NEED this app. It keeps track of your orders, lets you create a sub and then save it as a ‚Äòfavorite‚Äô, so next time you just click on the ‚Äòfavorites‚Äô button and choose it. You also earn coins. Collect enough (easy to do) and you can get $2 off your next purchase (or save them up until you have $4, or more). Different deals going on through the app, too, such as free cookies, drinks, or chips, or even great deals like 2 foot long subs for $5 each. The app will also email you other promotions going on. Finally (the best thing) is that you do not have to stand in line. Place your order through the app, wait 10 minutes or so, then simply walk in and get your sub. If you are not using this app, you are missing out!

title: Improving over time.
review:
Update: Since I originally posted this review, they have updated the app and fixed the problems I previously complained about.  As a result, I am revising this upward. 

Original: I really love the convenience of being able to order my food ahead of time and pick it up without having to wait in line. Unfortunately, they keep ‚Äúimproving‚Äù the app and breaking things.  I dread seeing an update to this app because I never know if anything will work right. Today, I opened the app to order and I couldn‚Äôt find my favorites, it kept fighting me on changing restaurants and it kept telling me it‚Äôs pickup time for an order I picked up two days ago. 

I finally managed to get the restaurant changed ‚Äî or so I thought because the screen had the restaurant I wanted ‚Äî and started an order from a previous order. I favorited the sandwich, but favorites still don‚Äôt appear anywhere.  To add insult to injury, I opened the email confirming the order and guess where it sent my order ‚Äî to the subway it didn‚Äôt want to let me change away from in the first place. 

This seems to happen whenever there is a major update. Functionality either disappears, fights you, does the wrong thing or just doesn‚Äôt work at all. It‚Äôs really frustrating and I‚Äôm sick of it.
developerResponse: {'id': 1752027, 'body': 'Hey there- we apologize for the confusion! We updated the app with a new feature to save a favorite without saving it to a specific location. Set your order as a favorite after checkout on your next order. Now you can tap on the "favorites" section after tapping "start order" for any location you\'re ordering from! For technical concerns, please contact our support team at (800)-888-4848 or by email at appfeedback@subway.com. Thank You!', 'modified': '2018-09-15T18:07:31Z'}

title: yahooey subway app yum yum
review: this app is fine, it does the job mostly. i however have had experiences where it absolutely went non-functional and i‚Äôd get stuck on loading screens and/or have to redo my order. quick customization and pickup is nice‚Äîbut delivery feels like a scam. they make a big deal about ‚Äúfree‚Äù delivery and other discounts but the majority of discounts you apply will be negated by the small order fee. i understand and celebrate the need for adequate pay for delivery drivers, but giving me a $3 off coupon and adding most of it back kinda defeats the whole purpose of having a discount to begin with. this issue won‚Äôt effect larger orders, but for someone like me who‚Äôs just ordering a meal for one (which i imagine is the VAST majority of users) it‚Äôs pointless. just save us the trouble and don‚Äôt hang discounts in front of our faces if they don‚Äôt mean anything :/

title: Very disappointed with the app
review:
I placed an order for delivery through the Subway app.   Apparently then, a DoorDash delivery driver came into the store to pick up my order, but Subway had never received it, so I never got my delivery, and got a notification that my order had been cancelled.   I called the store directly, who then took my order over the phone and I had to go get my food as a pickup.  The employees told me that they never have had any delivery drivers and were very confused as to why there was a delivery option on the app when they have no delivery at all.   They were also concerned that the order was never submitted to them from the delivery app.  

So, because this was inconvenient for both me and the employees, I‚Äôm rating it a 1, and will be deleting this useless app.  

When I use an app, I expect it to work, and I expect it to communicate to the restaurant it says it does.   This does neither.  The employees were great, and made up for the poor quality of this app.

title: App submitted orders before completed
review: This is the 2nd time that the app has submitted and order before I was ready. The first time wasn‚Äôt a big deal because there weren‚Äôt any coupons but today you had the promo for the buy one get one for $1. Right after I hit the second sandwich the app closed and when I reopened it the order was submitted before I was able to add on my other two footlongs. Called the store and they couldn‚Äôt understand why I was upset and told me just to add on the other sandwiches with another app order with the coupon but the coupon is gone. They kept telling me it would work but it wasn‚Äôt showing up on my end and I wasn‚Äôt going to place an order and be charged something different. This is my only frustration with the app I love the deals I don‚Äôt know why this has happened twice now. And I usually only treat my kids to subway if we have app deals so if this can‚Äôt be resolved well unfortunately have to be done with subway.

title: Great app, just not for food.
review: I loved this app. It was so convenient to be able to pick up a quick lunch, and with 1 click be able to order, and pay my last specific order ‚Äú4 people‚Äù without any hassle. However today I hit ‚Äúrepeat last order‚Äù on the app Only to walk in and have some kid yell ‚Äúcash only man!‚Äù I said ‚Äúthat‚Äôs cool I have already paid, with Apple Pay on the app I can show you the proof from my bank‚Äù. He said ‚Äúoh I have to call my district manager and see what you ordered?‚Äù After 26 minutes of waiting for this dude to call back I said ‚Äúthis is not worth getting fired over‚Äù (lunch break)! And went back to work. I could call my bank and say ‚ÄúI paid for nothing‚Äù who would believe that? I could call subway and received nothing and be in the same boat. So I‚Äôm out $25. There is no safe guards on this app. You probably could order, and after hours only to show up to a closed building. This app is awesome just call first to verify they are functional.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work
review:
UPDATE: Subway fixed the issue and I was actually able to place an order from the app. Thank you, Subway!! Updated my rating from 1 star to 4. 

The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is because the user experience could be better. While the new experience looks cool, I like the old user experience better because all options were right on the same screen. For example, I wanted cheese on my sandwich and had to go hunting around until I found on a separate page I could add it. It‚Äôd be nice to have all options available on the same page. But it‚Äôs usable and I‚Äôm just glad I can order from the app again! 

ORIGINAL REVIEW: App just sits at loading screen. Been doing this for several months. Still doing it after most recent update. This happened on my iPhone 6 and is still doing it on my iPhone XS Max.

We heard your feedback loud and clear, and now have a fix for the pesky issue you described (which will not require you to have location services enabled to login). \n \nPlease update to the latest version of the Subway¬Æ App, and please feel free to call us at (833)-778-2929 if you are still experiencing any issues.', 'modified': '2019-05-28T20:50:12Z'}

title: Great app with a few minor issues
review: My kids eat Subway about once a week so when I saw there was an app I was thrilled. Downloaded and it was buggy at first but it seems they just had a few launch hiccups. So if you had problems before.. circle back and try it again. The main issues I have with the app is the fact that I can‚Äôt ‚Äúpre-build‚Äù a favorite (or at least it isn‚Äôt obvious where I can build my custom sandwich and favorite it without submitting an order). I tried to pre-build and save as a favorite so that the next time i headed there.. I could submit my kids order, walk in and pickup .. but no. That isn‚Äôt an option. One has to submit an order first and THEN you can favorite it. The second issue I have is no Apple Pay. Come on guys.... it isn‚Äôt that hard to add in!
developerResponse: {'id': 10265623, 'body': "Your feedback is really important to us and we're always looking for ways to improve your experience! Feel free to reach out to our team by tapping 'Contact Us' in the Menu, at (833)-778-2929, or by email at appfeedback@subway.com.\r\n", 'modified': '2021-07-10T00:19:14Z'}

title: Re-ordering and favorites broken or non-intuitive
review:
The options to re-order from a past order and to create or use a favorite are either not working as intended or just not user-friendly. I tapped a  ‚Äúwant to re-order?‚Äù link, which showed me prior order from September...but there was no apparent way to actually use this to start an order. Maybe if I already had an order in process, there would be? But in my case I just wanted exactly what I got last time, so I hadn‚Äôt already started an order. I ended up just re-creating it from scratch.

Similarly, I saw that I had no favorites (thought a prior order might go here automatically, but I get why they're separate). It said you could create a favorite as you order. When I got to the end of ordering, I saw a little favorites heart icon...but that just took me to the ‚Äúyou have no favorites‚Äù page.

I know these are first-world problems...but the time-saving features ended up just taking extra time.
developerResponse: {'id': 5629431, 'body': "Your feedback is really important to us and we're always looking for ways to improve your experience! Feel free to reach out to us at (833)-778-2929 or via email at appfeedback@subway.com.", 'modified': '2018-10-23T15:03:13Z'}

title: Zero accountability for mistakes
review:
App gets the job done to place order, but no recourse for mistakes in those orders.  Order placed isn‚Äôt what is printed on receipts, everything is jumbled or revisioned leading to frequent mistakes in fulfillment.  This is a hollow shell of a useful app.  It exists only to take your money and leave you in the wind when they inevitably mess up your order.

The only way to contact customer service to report a problem is through a form on the website where they request your personal information which they share with to the local store, and have the store call you to say they‚Äôll fix it on the next order - no options for a credit or refund.  They literally want you to follow up on their mistakes by spending more money with them.

If you‚Äôre going to order subway you are better off using a delivery service instead of this app - at least they listen and respond to bad service by giving you back what you are owed.

title: No turkey for a month???
review: I used this app once a week to order lunch for my family at a franchise nearby that gets overrun with teenagers on lunch break from school. I loved that I could just grab my sandwiches and head out, plus the sandwich artists did a great job getting our order correct every time. Then, about a month ago, the app started saying the store was sold out of several options, including turkey. I tried placing my order at a different franchise, but turkey was sold out there too??? I finally realized that one of the sandwiches still being offered had turkey in it, so I doubt this is just a supply problem. It‚Äôs been over a month of not being able to use this app to order a turkey sandwich. Unfortunately, without the app, I just get lunch somewhere else because the store is too busy when I need to pick up lunch. I hope they fix it, but after a month I am losing hope.

title: Needs the Gluten Free bread option!
review:
UPDATE: Please allow the gluten free bread option when building a sandwich using the app! This app is now useless to us since we have 1 GF family member and the app doesn't list GF bread as a choice, even though our Subway offers it in the restaurant. Additionally, the updated version is nowhere near as easy to use as the original version. It crashes and is slow overall. 

Original: I love this Subway option! We used to avoid Subway with 3 kids because the lines are always long. Not anymore! This app lets us build our sandwiches quickly and easily and even pay ahead of time. We just show up, skip the massive line, and get handed our order. The fact that the options are limited for sides on the app is alleviated by the fact that they let you grab them at our Subway so I can still get the chips we want even though they don't show up on the app. This is a game-changer for us when we occasionally need to eat out and find a fast food option. Genius!
developerResponse: {'id': 1222649, 'body': 'We are working on ways to improve the app experience -we would love your feedback to understand how to make the process easier for you. Please reach out to us at 1-800-888-4848 or via email at appfeedback@subway.com.', 'modified': '2017-11-21T23:36:21Z'}

title: I love the Subway App
review:
I have always loved Subway sandwiches and felt like they are a healthy fast food choice but the drive thru line is always long because the sandwiches are not pressed.

I have not felt comfortable using the kiosk the chains have turned to since the Covid virus since I don‚Äôt want to touch a screen everyone else had touch do we have quit going to Subway for this reason until I found this app. 

No more waiting in the long line in the drive through. I just order my sandwiches in the app. By the time I drive to the Subway store the sandwiches are waiting for me on a designated shelf in the store. All paid for so I don‚Äôt have to wait in any line in the store. I just walk in and out! It is great!

title: Enough is Enough
review: It‚Äôs a great idea!  And I use similar apps with other fast food chains.  The app works great and I can detail exactly what I want.  NOW, it‚Äôs seems about 90% of the time (and I‚Äôve been using this for about 3 yearsish), the staff at these Subway chains seem to ALWAYS not read my orders correctly, especially when it comes to seasonings, ‚Äúextras‚Äù like extra lettuce, etc., and double meats.  It‚Äôs like every time I open my sandwich on the road......I‚Äôm like ‚Äúthat‚Äôs such a small looking sandwich!!‚Äù.  Every time when I‚Äôm actually inside Subway they get my orders right because I‚Äôm there to watch them.  I think most of these workers like the app so they don‚Äôt have to use up all the food and make them smaller in size OR they just don‚Äôt like reading the details.  It‚Äôs been happening at TONS of these chains.   Enough is Enough, I will stop using this app and will just stick to going inside from here on.  I love Subway but I sure do not like the execution of the orders from the app.

title: App not worth the time
review: Have been using the app for a while now. In my opinion, the app is not worth the time. Very slow and too many steps involved to make an order. Most of the time you can just go to the store and order faster than using the app. Takes several minutes to go through all the steps to make an order then if you don‚Äôt remember to put your order in in advance the app turns into a 30 minute process over all. There are also frequent updates which tells you the app developer is figuring things out on the fly and constantly having to correct things. Constantly have new bugs with mine after every update like not attaching my name to the order and listing it as unknown confusing the restaurants I‚Äôm ordering at. Subway is convenient because of so many locations but I enjoy using the Lenny‚Äôs app when a restaurant is in the area I‚Äôm in, much better. It is so simple, they just don‚Äôt have as many locations.

title: version 7:  so sad
review:
Version 7 has one improvement and many problems.  Naming a favorite order and keeping it at the ready was an excellent idea.  But the mapping to find a restaurant is terrible.  Yesterday I couldn‚Äôt get it to let go of one restaurant so that I could find a closer one.   Today it's claiming that the there are NO restaurants in several locations where I know they exist.  And using pictures without words for designing a sandwich seems like a good mulitcultural idea, but it is more difficult for me.  

And why can't I add spinach? My customer is my sandwich I want to add spinach

This is now six months after I wrote the above. I haven‚Äôt proved the app quite a bit. Now the only thing that is needed is to allow you to save a favorite sandwich.   currently the favorites are all associated with specific restaurants. I wander all over the place, and only want a favorite sandwich, not a favorite restaurant.

title: Could be better‚Ä¶.
review:
When people order ahead, they order based on an ETA! This order should be placed within the specific store‚Äôs computer so that when coming early it can be retrieved and made upon arrival. I ordered for 4pm pickup and finished my storage unit 30 minutes early and am having to wait that 30 minutes for the order to be able to be prepared. Of course, I suggested looking at my app for the order and was refused, so that could just be someone who should not be in customer service at all! 
Regardless, the initial problem lays within your app! I‚Äôm sure you could take 5 minutes to figure out the 1s and 0s and make it happen on your next update of the app. 
Otherwise this is actually a 3.5 ‚≠êÔ∏è but not able to do that!! 
Make it better

title: Really cool app, but...
review: This app is really great overall. I love the user interface - extremely user friendly, clever, and unique. My only complaint is about the "Deals" feature. When you pick a deal, then pick a location, it should immediately tell the user if that location does not accept the deal. Instead, it allows the user to go through the entire ordering process before telling them at the end that the location chosen does not accept the deal. This would be tenable if it didn't force you to start the entire order completely over! If this one thing could be fixed, this app would be flawless. It really is a cool, well-built app overall. But that feature is a legit "I'll never use this stupid app again" thought inspiring annoyance. üò¨

title: Don‚Äôt order side items for delivery
review: Each time I‚Äôve ordered delivery through the app, something would be missing when it arrived. It‚Äôs the side items like chips or drinks that are missing. (Not the apps fault). It happened today and the only way to report it is to call the restaurant that fulfilled the order. This turned out to be pointless because they don‚Äôt do refunds for missing items. You have to go to the store to pick up the missing items, which defeats the purpose of the delivery option. I was offered a voucher for free 6 inch for the mistake, but the only way to get the voucher is to go to the restaurant. Again, defeating the purpose of delivery. Find a better way to report and refund missing items in the App. No one orders delivery just to be told to go to the restaurant to pick up missing items.

title: Some updates needed
review: Ordering is very easy through the app and I love that they offer deals and rewards. My biggest beef is that you can‚Äôt order more than an hour ahead of time. I have a very limited lunch time and I would like to order in the mornings and schedule my pick up time but it will not let you. Furthermore if you tried to order from a store that is not open yet do you have to wait until they open as it will not let you select that store. I would simply like to select my sub and store for a schedule the time every day like I do on so many other apps. They need to fix this so that you can schedule a pick up time more than one hour in advance. Highly frustrating trying to order and pick up all in 30 minutes

title: Yikes y‚Äôall
review:
I get an unspecified error when trying to sign up, on both the app and the website. I‚Äôve tried different email addresses, I‚Äôve tried removing the (-) from my phone number, I've followed the password requirements to a T. The error says to call their number and then press #2. I do this, only to be greeted by a very happy robot lady telling me that I‚Äôm being better served by robots than humans, which might be true, except this robot is clearly a sadist. I press #2, as the app says, then the cheery psycho robot lady says ‚Äúthere‚Äôs a problem sending the text‚Äù and tells me to go back online.

I have no way of contacting an actual human. How do I sign up? How do I load a gift card? I know you guys are in the middle of a big rebranding, but this is silly. I just want food. Send me to some outsourced phone rep on the other side of the planet, I don‚Äôt care. Give me food. Give me human contact. Give me Steph Curry if you want. I just want to load a gift card. My gosh.

title: Sometimes have problems with app
review: I love ordering online on Subway because I get deals that way; however, the app usually goes slow, my order doesn‚Äôt always go through and I‚Äôve had problems getting my favorites to go through easily. This last time it worked really well but I kept getting an error message and the cart didn‚Äôt show that it went through but I ended up having the item in there. Since I didn‚Äôt know it went through I ordered it again and ended up having 2 orders of the same sub. Once I figured out the error message wasn‚Äôt really an error I just ok‚Äôd through them and arrowed back each time I wanted to go back to the main menu with the favorites bar again. Using the icons for ‚Äúadd another‚Äù didn‚Äôt work.

title: It‚Äôs gotten worse
review:
This app is no longer user friendly, WHATSOEVER. I have tried being patient but everytime I try to find a way to contact support I just keep getting sent in a never ending loop. The subway mobile app website that says if you are having issues go under the ‚Äúcontact us‚Äù in their app... well that doesn‚Äôt exist. 

I just want help because my subway offers the flatbread option but for some reason on the app it isn‚Äôt showing up. I have tried deleting and re-downloding and it does nothing.  Another big user error is that if I want to get plain chicken strips I have to order the premade bacon chicken sandwich and I can‚Äôt eat bacon, and there is no option to remove bacon.

It‚Äôs a sub shop, there should just be a build your own sub option.  I really don‚Äôt leave bad reviews but I really like subway and this app has been great until recent changes and I can‚Äôt get anyone to help me. PLEASE SEND HELP, leaving this review is the only way I can think of to get someone to reach out.

title: This should be more convenient
review:
If the restaurant isn‚Äôt open, you can‚Äôt even browse a menu, much less pre-assemble your sandwich in advance. One should be able to pick the sandwich and ingredients they want whenever they want, then submit the order at the appropriate time, or even save it to the Favorites. 

Similarly, you have to submit your order no more than one hour (+/-) in advance of the pickup time. A much smaller (and less affluential) regional chain has managed to make it possible to submit an order not only several hours in advance, but a WEEK in advance. 

One should be able to submit a lunch order before going to work in the morning, so one could just leave for lunch at the appropriate time without having had to use work time to choose and submit an order, or try to do it while rushing to the restaurant during a limited lunch break.

title: Special Instructions messed up! Please fix!
review: I put special instructions for my husband‚Äôs sandwich and I called to make sure they read the instructions because a lot of times they just don‚Äôt read it. I called and asked if they followed my instructions and he said no it did not go through. So when I picked up the order I looked at the receipt and it was there, just all together without any spaces in between the words. It was all just one line so I can see how he said it didn‚Äôt go through. It wasn‚Äôt his fault this time! You need to look at it and fix the bug. If you need to see the receipt let me know and I‚Äôll send a copy. Otherwise please fix this problem. This has not happened before so not sure what‚Äôs going on. Otherwise I love the app.

title: Worst designed app I‚Äôve ever seen
review: I have a family of four, one being autistic, so our orders get king and complicated. I tried to order a sandwich with just salami and bologna but I couldn‚Äôt because there‚Äôs NO option to create a sandwich from SCRATCH. It MAKES you pick a premade sandwich and customize it‚Äîthis wouldn‚Äôt be a bad thing if it didn‚Äôt disable you from changing the meats, so you HAVE to pick whatever meat combo they have preset. What‚Äôs the point of that? Subway is for allowing anything to be CUSTOMIZABLE, so why can‚Äôt I just have an option to create a sandwich from scratch? Next, the app doesn‚Äôt show all the toppings, drink, and chip options. I tried to get oregano but it‚Äôs not even an option. I tried to get Salt and Vinegar Lays chips‚Äîthey didn‚Äôt have the option. I know the location has it so why not the app? App is the most frustrating app I‚Äôve ever had the displeasure of ordering from.

title: Clunky and very glitchy, but has improved
review: I wrote a really bad review of this app a while ago, because it was hands down the worst take-out app as far as design, but it has been improving and is now ‚Äúokay‚Äù. The food is always correct and ready on-time. The app requires frequent updates and won‚Äôt let you order without the update, meaning if you‚Äôre in a hurry you have to wait. The UI is better than it was, and not quite as cluttered, but it is very, very buggy. Sometimes you can‚Äôt order at all because it glitches out. It‚Äôs not always the same glitch, either, it messed up at different steps. Out of the past dozen times I have used the app, three times I couldn‚Äôt complete the order and had to go in person and order at the counter, and once I just ordered from somewhere else.

title: Needs Work
review: The app functions well but really caters only to customers that want to order specific menu options. There should be a ‚Äúcustomized sandwich‚Äù or ‚Äúcreate your own‚Äù option to allow customers to order exactly what they want. All menu sandwich items have locked items that the customer cannot remove. My specific location doesn‚Äôt honor promotions or member points unless you order through the app because they don‚Äôt have a scanner on site. Some locations may have different ingredients from other locations and if that‚Äôs the case then the app should pull based on the location. I realize that requires more work but it provides full service to customers which should be the priority. In the end, I can‚Äôt even use the app or benefit from promotions or member points due to not being able to fully customize my order.

title: Is good but need improvement
review: The app is good but needs improvement. It needs improvement in my opinion around the store location button . And I guess she read my GPS and see where I at I was sickness I want Subway. Like I should read my GPS and see where I‚Äôm at I was sitting there so I want to Subway and ordered from another subway seven minutes away previouslyAnd it sent my order back to where I had previously ordered which was a hassle but I needed to double check that IAdmit that but it would‚Äôve been a lot easier if it double checked and verified where I wanted to place my order. Also canceling ordersShould be a really a one button push instead of a phone call and there should be a feature where you double check if you‚Äôre sure you want to place the order instead of one touch press your order is going to be ready etc.

title: A 1 Star Reason to Believe
review: So apparently, I went to this app, hoping it can be a service to me for "ordering on the go". Looks like this app doesn't do so well when trying to "ADD A NEW PAYMENT METHOD!" Yes, seriously, adding a new payment method. It seems that the most buggy and most messy mistake of this app would be adding a new payment method. How is it that this app can give me an error whenever I try to add a new payment method?! I DON'T KNOW! What I do know is that subway will fail at their job of "not" fixing this problem, if they don't tackle this issue soon. Please! I BEG YOU! Fix the issue where I receive an error for adding a new payment method! It doesn't have to be this way! You can change my life for the better if you fix this issue quickly. I don't know how much longer I can wait before I order on the go on Subway again. I think I'll die without Subway's working order app (joke implied). Anyway, please fix this issue soon and PLEASE reply back ASAP and let me know if it is fixed. THANKS!

title: Worst App - Do Not Use With Gift Cards
review: This app is horrible. I hate using it. The navigation is awkward. There is a menu on the left but multiple ways to access things (ie payment method and gift cards) all of which are a dead end and then you have to go back to home page again to do anything. In addition, I linked my gift card in the app. Since it was downloaded to the app, I threw away the physical card. I mean, that is the point of the app right? Unfortunately I have gone to 3 separate Subways and tried to use the app to pay for my meal and they are not able to use the gift card within the app. So now I have to use a credit card even though I have $25 on my inaccessible gift card which is infuriating. I ask the employees in the store why it does work and they say they do not know or the computer just says invalid payment. I then show them my app and where it says I have money left on my gift card and they still say the system is not accepting it for some reason.

title: Fun and convenient but where‚Äôs all the options?
review: My problem is where are all the options? Where‚Äôs the option for milk in the ‚ÄúMake it a Meal?‚Äù screen. Also I just picked up my order and had to tolerate a Diet Coke because there‚Äôs no Mello Yello selection option in the app ANYWHERE that I can see. Yet I know for a fact it‚Äôs one of their drink options if you go into the stores. Same with chocolate milk. Also, seems there could be a ‚ÄúNotes‚Äù or ‚ÄúSpecial Instructions‚Äù option on each item so if you have kids that are splitting a tuna sandwich and one wants olives on their half and the other wants pickles in their half one could send that request through. Currently I don‚Äôt see ANY of these seemingly no-brainer ideas as part of this app. Now I titled this review the way I did because I think for the most part it‚Äôs a nice app and it‚Äôs convenient. It just seems very inadequate when it comes to having all their options available.

title: Toasted or Untoasted? That‚Äôs the question!
review:
Your app is defective. Why is it that on the other food delivery apps CUSTOMERS choose whether they would like their sandwich toasted or not but on the actual SUBWAY app SUBWAY has made the decision to TOAST all sandwiches by default unless the customer specifically chooses not toasted? Why is TOASTED chosen for us and the app allows the customer to submit the order without choosing for themselves? I feel that the app needs an update that UNCHECKS TOASTED and allows the customer themselves to choose how they would like their sandwich prepared. 

Another company would have compensated me for my negative experience while Subway just says, ‚ÄúThank you for your feedback.‚Äù Yeah, I think that was my last Subway experience.

title: 3 stars maybe generous
review:
Over all, it does work. Layout is fine, nothing to write home about. 
BUT‚Ä¶.
Every launch of the app starts with an error. Not a comforting sign, but I have been using it and it works, so I think it is just something they over looked. 
My big issue is with the mapping. They show you pins on the map, but when it comes to finding a convenient location, you better be familiar with the address system in your town (or leave the app and Google, but I ahiuldnt have to do that). Every other food app shows the pins on a map. You click on them and that stores info comes up and ready to order. The map and the address list are in no way connected. 
I ended up driving across town and back again to find which store had received my order. Very frustrated.

title: Real nice app but.....
review:
It‚Äôs crazy how when you order a sandwich online and it has everything included like lettuce,tomato etc. Everything else except the CHEESE(which is usually included free) which if you forget to add you have to tell the person to remake it or go home with no cheese on your sandwiches. I ordered online picked it up and went home. 

So I called the guy who made the sandwich and he forgot to add other toppings like olives and onions. So I basically had this weightless sandwich.  Basically he said he couldn‚Äôt do anything about it. I told him every time I use the app something messes up and I admitted it was my fault I forgot the cheese. But I said everyone would get cheese on there sandwich it‚Äôs like ordering a pizza with no cheese. He said sorry that he couldn‚Äôt offer me anything or a refund and he told me to complain about the app.

title: Recent Order tab auto fills order location
review:
The problem is that it not only re-orders the sandwich and sides, but the app also chooses the same store location even though a customer just selected a different store. 

Generally I like this app. I was frustrated when today I placed an order from it. I found a store that was near me and convenient for pick up and ‚Äòselected‚Äô that store. Then I went to the handy recent orders tab. There it lists what I have ordered in the past. It also shows the date, time and location of those purchases. I selected a sandwich from that list and chose to re-order it. I was disappointed to find out that I needed to drive another 30 miles to claim my now 45 minute old, not so fresh sandwich.
